definitions.definition: Something that is mandatory or required.
definitions.example: If you'll be out all day, a map is a must.

definitions.definition: (modal auxiliary, defective) To do with certainty; indicates that the speaker is certain that the subject will have executed the predicate.
definitions.example: If it has rained all day, it must be very wet outside.

definitions.definition: (modal auxiliary, defective) To do as a requirement; indicates that the sentence subject is required as an imperative or directive to execute the sentence predicate, with failure to do so resulting in a negative consequence.
definitions.example: This door handle must be rotated fully.

definitions.definition: (modal auxiliary, defective) said about something that is very likely, probable, or certain to be true
definitions.example: The children must be asleep by now.

definitions.definition: The property of being stale or musty.
Something that exhibits the property of being stale or musty.
Fruit juice that will ferment or has fermented, usually from grapes.
A time during which male elephants exhibit increased levels of sexual activity and aggressiveness (also spelled musth).
An elephant in this sexual and aggressive state.
